meanings.definition: The quality or state of being specious.
meanings.sent1: The speciosities of his argument made it seem true at first glance.
meanings.sent2: She was drawn in by the speciosities of the advertisement.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick relied on the speciosities of misdirection.
meanings.sent4: The speciosities of the mirage deceived the weary travelers.
meanings.sent5: The speciosities of the fake painting fooled many art enthusiasts.

meanings.sent1: The detective uncovered the speciosities in the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent2: The salesman's pitch was full of speciosities to lure customers.
meanings.sent3: The speciosities of the counterfeit product were quickly exposed.
meanings.sent4: The speciosities of the conspiracy theory were unravelled by the investigators.
meanings.sent5: The speciosities of the scam were finally revealed to the public.
